title: Does new Fiora have a single counter?
body:
This is a serious question, I can't think of a single counter for her and very few laners can even CS without being butchered. Her %HP true damage counters tanks, her parry counters champions who would have countered her if she didn't have it (Teemo, Riven, Jax's counterstrike even causes him to stun himself against her while she negates his stun), she has a gap closer to prevent ranged champions from dealing with her. She even has phenomenal teamfighting. 

At least when I saw Riven top every game before the Fiora rework I could grab Olaf or Darius to deal with her. Now Fiora seems to be able to deal with anyone who doesn't have absolutely instantaneous CC but most of the champions who have that are tanks that can't deal with her true damage.

Have you tried using {{champion:117}}?

You can harass her from a pretty safe distance and slow her with Q. Also Lulu can peel for any of her allies that Fiora is trying to kill.

Well, of course she has a counter, it's called Riposte.

But on a serious note, good champs to pick would probably be anyone who can harass her better than she can them (I'm thinking people like {{champion:150}} or {{champion:127}}, maybe {{champion:80}} {{champion:6}} and {{champion:2}} too) people who are good against AD and or auto-attackers (say {{champion:54}} {{champion:33}} {{champion:44}}) and people who can either out-burst her in an all in (basically kill her before she can get her ult heal) or survive her all in on their own. There are also standard top bullies like {{champion:117}} {{champion:74}} {{champion:48}} who fair pretty well against her early game.

I'd actually be really interested to see how a lane Rammus does against Fiora, I've never seen that matchup but I bet a bruiser Rammus could do pretty well against her. 

My personal favorite would probably be Lissandra since she is so good against melee, she can self peel really well, and if she gets all-ined she can ult herself to wait out some of the duration of Fiora's ult while also healing herself for a fair amount.

the problem of rammus and similar picks is that her scaleing truedamage destroys them later in the game.
early on, it's rather ignorable, but with 4items+ it's above 12%hp for each vital.
If you have a early-mid setup and can snowball it through, np, but if she ever reaches lategame, you will regret that tank pick.

what works best from my experience are ranged laners with good disengage, as she lacks sustain, her Q has rather low range and high cd early on.
brutal early bullys like renekton or pant also work well, though they have the same prob as tanks and need to finish the game early.

Best. Passive. Ever.
Pardon me, new to the Baker Man, how does his passive assist against the French Fencer?

Her vitals count as basic attacks.  Pantheon's passive blocks basic attacks from champions (though some champions are different).  Careful stacking of your passive can block two of her next vital hits, leaving you free to damage her in trades.  This also works towards your benefit because you have more range than her (and you can't miss because Q) so you can punish her for keeping her distance and for coming up close (since his E active deals double damage to champions).

Blocks autos and he can put his passive on immediately after using his stun. Which means he can get it twice. Fiora primarily relies on using her auto attacks to win trades in general.

All you have to do is make sure you don't try to stun her when she's riposting.

Fiora's counter is walls.  And distance.

If you are moving towards fiora, you see where the vital will spawn.  If it is in her direction, take a step back to lose the buff, then approach again for a new vital direction.

If fiora engages you, stand next to a wall to block the vital.  You will almost always win trades vs Fiora if she cannot get to the vital.  This will also stop her from proc'ing her ult -- just stand directly against a wall and she cannot get the heal unless you die.

The problem is if she Q's next to you the Q will penetrate your hitbox and hit the vital regardless. Yes, you heard that right, the direction of the vital doesn't really matter if she gets close to you.

Her early game damage isn't the best.
Strong early game champions can overpower her and prevent her to scale up. As well, ranged champions can dish out some free harass on Fiora since Lunge isn't exactly the best gap closer.

{{champion:23}} works extremely well against Fiora. The massive AD reduction on his shout cripples her ultimate. He and Fiora can both regenerate health at around the same rate, but he significantly outclasses Fiora in trading.

{{champion:54}} also does alright. She does turn the match up against him later, but early game, his passive shield negates 1 to 2 vital procs. Malphite can easily trade back or disengage from Fiora with Q or E. As well, Fiora can't parry his ultimate at point blank range unless she does it preemptively.

{{champion:68}} countered the old Fiora, and counters the new one. He wins the same reason Malphite does; his shield blocks 1 to 2 vital procs early game. This gives Rumble ample breathing space to harass with Q and kite back with E.
As well, Rumble's ultimate equalizes (pun not intended) the healing component of Fiora's ultimate, and it has just as much impact as Fiora's ultimate in a team fight.

{{champion:74}} counters all melee fighters. Fiora might be able to try something once she hits 6, but if she missteps without her ultimate, it is a kill for the 'donger.

It's a problem of player agency, with most champions you could say Fiora is a skill matchup, but you have no agency on it, it depends merely on how skilled the Fiora is. For example when I play {{champion:50}}, it's a matter of if she knows how to handle the matchup, or if she burns her parry before the root, I don't get to outplay, but she does.

Same goes for Zed, Yasuo and Kalista, or Riven for that matter, you depend on the other person being bad, no matter how hard a champion is to play, it doesn't make you feel any better when they know how to play them and you're in lose-lose scenarios.

You're preaching to the choir. She could have absolutely nothing other than her %HP true damage and riposte and she'd be broken. A champion with true damage should never be given self peel or worse yet, a way to ignore CC. She can even riposte exhaust and ignite. On top of this she has 2 slows, an MS boost, 2 heals, and a gap closer. 

She's as strong as the juggernauts so I just can't wrap my head around why she has her lunge. She needs either her riposte, true damage, or lunge retuned, then she might be balanced.

Honestly, she has a lot of counters, people just take more time complaining than they do trying to find them, just like the new Darius. Gangplank can kinda of go toe to toe with her. I've played the new Fiora since she was released, and I've got a good deal of how to deal with her. Denying her farm really sets her back, because most first tier 3 items (Hydra, or Trinity Force) cost quite a bit. Depending on her first item, she's not that good at farming early on either, as her autos feel kind of wonky, even after all this time. I can't explain it.  Taking a Dorans blade leaves her with one potion, because she is pretty squishy early on, Taking a Long Sword just gives her brute damage with no way of healing other than her 3 potions. Flask is probably my favorite start for her for a couple reasons I won't get into because this post is pretty long already. It's kinda like process of elimination.
Her counter is the draft phase. If your team doesn't ban her there, then you guys probably deserve to lose.
